ppe_requirements.respiratory: SCBA or supplied-air respirator for >25 ppm or unknown concentrations. Air-purifying with ammonia cartridge acceptable for ≤25 ppm.
ppe_requirements.skin: Neoprene, nitrile, or butyl rubber gloves. Chemical-resistant clothing. Liquid ammonia causes severe burns and frostbite.
ppe_requirements.eye: Chemical safety goggles, full face shield. Extremely irritating and corrosive to eyes.
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level C for known <25 ppm, Level B for >25 ppm or liquefied ammonia
ppe_requirements.special_notes: Extremely irritating at low concentrations. Immediately dangerous above 300 ppm. Cryogenic liquid causes frostbite. Emergency eyewash/shower within 10 seconds.

physical_properties.appearance: Colorless gas, colorless liquid under pressure

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Flammable gas. Narrow explosive range but ignites easily. Vapors lighter than air - rise and disperse. May reignite after flame is extinguished.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Stop flow if safe to do so. Do not extinguish flame unless leak can be stopped. Cool cylinders with water spray from safe distance. Use dry chemical, CO2 from maximum distance.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: EVACUATE. Ventilate area. SCBA required for liquid releases or >300 ppm. Contain with water spray or fog. Dilute with water. Neutralize with acid (sulfuric, hydrochloric). Dike large liquid spills.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove to fresh air immediately. Eyes: flush with water for 15+ minutes - CRITICAL. Remove contaminated clothing. Wash skin with water. If inhaled: administer oxygen. Seek immediate medical attention - severe irritation likely.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Toxic to aquatic life at high concentrations. Rapid volatilization from water. Report releases >100 lbs.
emergency_response.special_hazards: Extremely irritating and corrosive to eyes, skin, and respiratory tract. Causes severe chemical burns. Cryogenic liquid causes frostbite. Forms explosive mixtures with air. Reacts violently with acids and halogens.

storage_requirements.temperature_range: Store cylinders <52°C. Keep away from heat.
storage_requirements.ventilation: Outdoor storage preferred. Indoor: mechanical ventilation with emergency backup. Ammonia gas detection mandatory.
storage_requirements.container_material: Steel cylinders for compressed gas. Stainless steel for solutions.
storage_requirements.segregation: Separate from acids by 20 feet or firewall. Separate from oxidizers and halogens. Flammable gas storage.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Per fire code. Refrigeration systems subject to special regulations.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Cylinder restraints mandatory. Leak detection system required. Post "FLAMMABLE GAS" and "CORROSIVE" signs. Emergency eyewash/shower within 25 feet. Avoid contact with copper, brass, zinc in piping.

regulatory_classification.dot_hazard_class: 2.2 (Non-flammable gas) or 2.3 (Toxic gas) depending on concentration

reactivity.reactivity_hazard: Reacts violently with strong acids producing heat and ammonium salts. Explosive reaction with halogens. Attacks copper, brass, zinc, aluminum, and alloys.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Toxic to fish at high concentrations. LC50 (fish, 96h): 0.5-2.0 mg/L un-ionized NH3. Unionized form highly toxic.
environmental_impact.biodegradability: Readily biodegradable. Nitrifying bacteria convert to nitrate.
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: High mobility as gas. Volatilizes from soil. Absorbed as ammonium ion.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Reacts with acids forming ammonium salts. Washed out by rain. Atmospheric residence: days.

detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: 5-50 ppm - provides good warning below toxic levels
